Diagram 2, Interactive

The diagram depicts the different types of twisted pair cables that are commonly found in networking applications. The characteristics are listed below:

Category 3 Cable (UTP)
Used for voice communication.
Most often used for phone lines.

Category 7 Cable (ScTP)
Used for data transmission.
Individual pairs are wrapped in a shield and then the entire four pairs are wrapped in another shield.
Supports 1000Mbps and 10Gbps, though 10Gbps is not recommended.

Category 6 UTP Cable (UTP)
Used for data transmission.
An added separator is between each pair of wires, allowing it to function at higher speeds.
Supports 1000Mbps and 10Gbps although 10Gbps is not recommended.

Category 5 and 5e UTP Cable (UTP)
Used for data transmission.
Cat 5 supports 100Mbps and can support 1000Mbps but is not recommended.
Cat 5e supports 1000Mbps.
